docs.snippet: BITENSKY--Halina. The entire Yeshiva University family is deeply grieved by the recent passing of our cherished longtime friend, Halina Bitensky, Z'l, who, together with her late beloved husband, Samson Bitensky, Z'l, a Yeshiva University Trustee ...
docs.lead_paragraph:
BITENSKY--Halina.

The entire Yeshiva University family is deeply grieved by the recent passing of our cherished longtime friend, Halina Bitensky, Z'l, who, together with her late beloved husband, Samson Bitensky, Z'l, a Yeshiva University Trustee and the founding Chair of the Ferkauf Graduate School of Psychology Board of Overseers, and a Vice Chair of the Sy Syms School of Business, was a Benefactor of Yeshiva University. They established the Samson and Halina Bitensky Chair in Economics at Yeshiva University, which was held by the late Professor Aaron Levine, who published several books in their honor, and they also established scholarship funds at Ferkauf Graduate School of Psychology and Stern College for Women. Halina Bitensky was a kind, gentle, generous, humble, compassionate and gracious lady. She was a proud mother of her two daughters and sons-in-law, Dr. Beth (and Steven) Myers, who was Chair of the Ferkauf Graduate School of Psychology Board of Overseers, and Susan (and Peter) Lerner, Esq., a past member of the Yeshiva University Museum Board of Overseers. Halina and Samson Bitensky were among the sponsors of the "Perfect Fit" Exhibit. She was an adoring grandmother and great grandmother. She had many friends who shared the values of the Bitensky family in philanthropic work on behalf of higher education here and in Israel. May the entire family be comforted among the mourners of Zion and Jerusalem. Yeshiva University Richard M. Joel, President Norman Lamm, President Emeritus

docs.snippet: FRIEDMAN--Shirley Ruth (Kopel) died peacefully on April 12th, 2016 in Canaan, CT at age 94. Adored wife of the late Lawrence Friedman, beloved mother of Joan Krey (Lewis), Laura Goldberg (Mark) and Barbara Friedman-Dow (Robert); proud grandmother ...
docs.lead_paragraph:
FRIEDMAN--Shirley

Ruth (Kopel) died peacefully on April 12th, 2016 in Canaan, CT at age 94. Adored wife of the late Lawrence Friedman, beloved mother of Joan Krey (Lewis), Laura Goldberg (Mark) and Barbara Friedman-Dow (Robert); proud grandmother of Theodore, Jocelyn, Adrienne, Marissa, Jordan, Samantha and Jeffery; contented great-grandmother of Nina; and her late brother Dr. Hugh Kopel. A graduate of Wayne State University, Shirley received a MA in Education from Columbia University Teachers' College and loved her 25 year career in teaching at which she excelled and impacted countless children's lives in Ossining. She was passionate about tennis, bridge, crossword puzzles, cooking, traveling, theatre and dogs. Always curious, adventurous, outspoken, and ready to tell a good joke. Donations to Living Waters Children Center Fund www.lwccfund.org/haiti/ for Haiti Fund.

docs.lead_paragraph:

April 21, 1928 - March 28, 2016. Beloved daughter, sister and aunt. Lifelong resident of Forest Hills, NY. Graduate of Miss Beard's School, 1945 and Cornell University, 1949. Daughter of the late Catharine E. Benisch and Henry J. Benisch. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to: Cornell Annual Fund for Human Ecology, Cornell University, P.O. Box 25842, Lehigh Valley, PA 18003-9692.

docs.snippet: NIELSEN--Marcia. Born on a kitchen table in Queens Village, Queens in 1921 to Rebecca and Abraham Kaplan, Marcia Kaplan Nielsen died in her Upper East Side home of 60 years on March 27, 2016. Marcia graduated from Queens College before moving to W...
docs.lead_paragraph:
NIELSEN--Marcia.

Born on a kitchen table in Queens Village, Queens in 1921 to Rebecca and Abraham Kaplan, Marcia Kaplan Nielsen died in her Upper East Side home of 60 years on March 27, 2016. Marcia graduated from Queens College before moving to Washington, DC where she met Waldemar "Wally" Nielsen with whom she shared an indelible bond marked by 62 years of marriage. Some of Marcia's fondest years were those she spent in Paris from 1948-1952 where Wally worked in the Marshall Plan, and where their daughter Signe was born. Marcia was an active member of the Democratic Party and an engaged volunteer in community and national organizations, but the work she was proudest of was her three decades as a college advisor at the Nightingale Bamford School. Sifting through her papers turns up letter after letter from former students who write about her impeccable style, directness, keen and level advice, and her compassion. Her daughter Signe, her granddaughter Marina, great-grandson Lukas, and many other relatives whose lives she has enriched survive her. A memorial service will be held at the Nightingale Bamford School on June 3 at 6pm. RSVP to: signe@mnlandscape.com

docs.snippet: LANG--Wesley W., of Stamford, CT died on April 11, 2016 at the age of 95. Born March 17, 1921 in New York, son of Otto and Catherine Lang and educated at Richmond Hill High (Queens, LI), Columbia University (B.A.), and NYU (M.B.A.). He served in t...
docs.lead_paragraph:
LANG--Wesley W.,

of Stamford, CT died on April 11, 2016 at the age of 95. Born March 17, 1921 in New York, son of Otto and Catherine Lang and educated at Richmond Hill High (Queens, LI), Columbia University (B.A.), and NYU (M.B.A.). He served in the United States Army Air Force in WWII. Thereafter, he was employed by A.D. Julliard, Pfizer Inc., Schrafft's and B. Altman & Co where he served as CFO and as a member of the board of directors. He is survived by Marion Lang (his wife of 69 years); their daughter Nancy of New York City; two sons, Wesley Jr. married to Mary Margaret (Gillin) of Palm Beach FL and their four daughters - Pamela married to Christopher (Golding), Emily, Jennifer and Elise; and Kenneth, married to Deborah (Van Bemmelen) and their two daughters Kathryn and Julia of Darien, CT. A private service will be held at Noroton Presbyterian Church in Darien, CT and a private interment in Naples, FL. In lieu of flowers, donations in Wesley's name are suggested to the charity of your choice or St. Jude Children's Research Hospital. www. lawrencefuneralhome.com.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  EASTON-LEAF, EVA Lois

docs.snippet: EASTON-LEAF--Eva Lois, born October 30, 1953 in Rochester, New York, died March 31, 2016 in Santa Monica, California. Fierce advocate of the truth. Believer in lost causes, champion of every fight she took on. The smartest and bravest person we al...
docs.lead_paragraph:
EASTON-LEAF--Eva Lois,

born October 30, 1953 in Rochester, New York, died March 31, 2016 in Santa Monica, California. Fierce advocate of the truth. Believer in lost causes, champion of every fight she took on. The smartest and bravest person we all knew. She always insisted on doing the right thing for the right reason, regardless of the personal cost. Much more than "my better half," she was and will remain my moral compass. Her great hero Senator Robert F. Kennedy set her course in life: "I dream of things that never were and ask, 'why not?' "Or, to slightly edit her musical hero, "God only knows what we'll be without her." Rest in peace, pumpkin. I love you the most. David
